diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Acute pancreatitis, constipation, cholangitis, portal vein thrombus
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal pain related to a newly diagnosed locally metastatic pancreatic cancer. A CT scan revealed a pancreatic head mass with biliary obstruction, and brushings from a prior procedure were positive for malignant cells. Despite symptom management, complications such as constipation and cholangitis were also considered but were secondary to the primary diagnosis of pancreatic cancer.
